title: Essay on Shinylive
text:
Shinylive is a new way to run Shiny apps without a server. That means your app runs directly in the web browser.
You just write a Shiny app as usual, and Shinylive takes care of making it run online â€” without needing a computer or server in the background.

With Shiny, the R code runs on a server. With Shinylive, the R code runs inside the userâ€™s web browser using special technology called WebAssembly.

title: Essay on Shinylive
text:
âœ… Pros of Shinylive

No need to manage servers
Great for small apps and demos
Runs anywhere: GitHub Pages, Quarto Pub, etc.
Simple to share (just a link)

title: Essay on Shinylive
text:

title: Essay on Shinylive
text:
ğŸ§¾ Summary
Shinylive is perfect for showing off small Shiny apps, teaching R, or making interactive tools for class or projects. Itâ€™s not meant for complex business dashboards, but itâ€™s a fast and fun way to make apps run anywhereâ€”with no setup.

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text: Shiny is a tool in R that helps you build interactive websites or dashboards using only R code. This is great for people who know R but not web programming.

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text: Shiny is a tool in R that helps you build interactive websites or dashboards using only R code. This is great for people who know R but not web programming.

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text:
ğŸ’¼ Why is Shiny Useful?
In business or research, we often want others to explore our data. Shiny lets you create simple apps where users can change inputs like sliders or dropdowns and immediately see new results, plots, or tables.

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text:
ğŸ”§ How Does It Work?
A Shiny app has two main parts:

UI (User Interface) â€“ Controls how the app looks

Server â€“ Controls what the app does

These are combined using shinyApp(ui, server).

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text:
ğŸ“ Summary
Shiny is a great way to turn your R analysis into something others can use. Itâ€™s perfect for dashboards, internal tools, and reports that update as users interact with them.
